sen.j: 實川 延若（じつかわ えんじろう）は、歌舞伎役者の名跡。
sen.e: "Enjiro JITSUKAWA" is a professional name which was used by some Kabuki (a traditional form of drama and music performed by male actors) actors.
sen.cmt: 「實川 延若」とありますがリンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「實川延二郎」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: "Enjiro JITSUKAWA" is a professional name which was used by some Kabuki (a traditional form of drama and music performed by male actors) actors.
"Enjiro JITSUKAWA" is a professional name which was used by some Kabuki (a traditional form of drama and music performed by male actors) actors.
The yago (stage family name) used by Enjiro JITSUKAWA was Kawachi-ya.
The yago (stage family name) used by Enjiro JITSUKAWA was Kawachi-ya.
The yago (stage family name) used by Enjiro JITSUKAWA was Kawachi-ya.

sen.j: 定紋は重ね井筒、替紋は五つ雁金。
sen.e: Their jomon (emblem of a Kabuki family) was Kasane-izutsu (literally, "double-izutsu [a family crest design based on a square wooden well crib]"), and their kaemon (alternate personal crest) was Itsusu-karigane (literally, "five wild goose").

Their jomon (emblem of a Kabuki family) was Kasane-izutsu (literally, "double-izutsu" [a family crest design based on a square wooden well crib]), and their kaemon (alternate personal crest) was Itsusu-karigane (literally, "five wild goose").
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: Their jomon (emblem of a Kabuki family) was Kasane-izutsu (literally, "double-izutsu" [a family crest design based on a square wooden well crib]), and their kaemon (alternate personal crest) was Itsusu-karigane (literally, "five wild goose").

sen.j: 實川延若に先立って襲名される名跡となっている。
sen.e: This professional name is used before succeeding to the name of Enjaku JITSUKAWA.
This professional name is used before succeeding to the name of Enjaku JITSUKAWA.
This professional name is used before succeeding to the name of Enjaku JITSUKAWA.
Enjiro JITSUKAWA the First
sen.cmt: リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「初代 實川延二郎」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Enjiro JITSUKAWA the First
Enjiro JITSUKAWA the First
He was the eldest son of Enjaku JITSUKAWA the First, and he lived from 1877 to 1951.
He was the eldest son of Enjaku JITSUKAWA the First, and he lived from 1877 to 1951.
He was the eldest son of Enjaku JITSUKAWA the First, and he lived from 1877 to 1951.

sen.j: 二代目實川延二郎 → 二代目實川延若。
sen.e: He succeeded to Enjito JITSUKAWA the Second and then he became Enjaku JITSUKAWA the Second.
sen.cmt: なぜここで「二代目實川延二郎」に言及されているのか不明ですが、原文のまま訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He succeeded to Enjito JITSUKAWA the Second and then he became Enjaku JITSUKAWA the Second.
He succeeded to Enjito JITSUKAWA the Second and then he became Enjaku JITSUKAWA the Second.

sen.j: 二代目 實川延二郎
sen.e: Enjiro JITSUKAWA the Second
sen.cmt: リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「二代目 實川延二郎」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Enjiro JITSUKAWA the Second
Enjiro JITSUKAWA the Second
He was the eldest son of the second generation and he lived from 1921 to 1991.
He was the eldest son of the second generation and he lived from 1921 to 1991.

sen.j: 三代目實川延二郎 → 三代目實川延若。
sen.e: He succeeded to Enjito JITSUKAWA the Third and then he became Enjaku JITSUKAWA the Third.
sen.cmt: なぜここで「三代目實川延二郎」に言及されているのか不明ですが、原文のまま訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He succeeded to Enjito JITSUKAWA the Third and then he became Enjaku JITSUKAWA the Third.
